result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas J. Schoechert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment as required by the Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, and counseling as required by the Agent
--to maintain absolute sobriety: no possession or consumption of alcohol; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--to take all prescribed medications only as prescribed 
--to continue treatment with Wisconsin Community Mental Health Center until successfully discharged by the treatment providers
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--to submit to monthly testing for illegal drug use
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon request 

Arresting Agency: JCSD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas J. Schoechert

records.addlTxt:
cases #13CF517, #13CF519, #14CF401 called at 1:17pm. [MK]
Defendant Thomas J. Schoechert in court with Attorney Joseph F. Fischer.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
In Case #14CF401, Service of the Complaint admitted; reading is waived.  
In Case #14CF401, Mr. Schoechert waives his right to Preliminary Hearing. The Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for trial. 
Service of the Information admitted, reading waived.
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " No Contest " entered in Case #13CF517 on Count #1, and in Case #13CF519 on Count #1, and in Case #14CF401 on Count #2; factual basis stipulated;  the Court accepts the pleas, finds Ms. Schoechert guilty, and orders Judgments of Conviction entered.


On agreement of the parties, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2 in Case #13CF519 and Count #1 in Case #14CF401.

During the sentencing portion of the hearing, a statement in support of Mr. Schoechert is given by Dan Roth. 


In Case #13CF517 on Count #1, and in Case #13CF519 on Count #1, and in Case #14CF401 on Count #2, the Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Schoechert on Probation for five years concurrent, with conditions:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment as required by the Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, and counseling as required by the Agent
--to maintain absolute sobriety: no possession or consumption of alcohol; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--to take all prescribed medications only as prescribed 
--to continue treatment with Wisconsin Community Mental Health Center until successfully discharged by the treatment providers
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--to submit to monthly testing for illegal drug use
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon request 
--in Case #13CF517 to pay costs of $268, plus the $250 DNA surcharge
, plus $125 in drug testing fees
--in Case #13CF519 to pay costs of $268, plus the $250 DNA surcharge, plus $25 in drug testing fees, plus $105 in subpoena fees 
--in Case #14CF401 to pay costs of $268, plus the $250 DNA surcharge


Counsel will submit a stipulation on sentence credit within thirty days. 
The Court finds that Mr. Schoechert is not eligible for special dispostion in these cases. 
Felony firearm/voting prohibition warnings given
recess 2:00pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 22, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
